newsitem.title: ITALY: Crediop 11-mnth net profit 71.5 bln lire.
newsitem.headline: Crediop 11-mnth net profit 71.5 bln lire.

text.p: Italian banking group Crediop said its net profit in the first eleven months of 1996 was 71.5 billion lire, while its operating profits were 281.2 billion lire.
The bank, whose core activity is lending to Italian local authorities and state entities, is wholly owned by Italy's largest commercial bank Istituto Bancario San Paolo di Torino.

A Crediop statement, coming on the same day as San Paolo's 1996 results, said its 11-month net interest income was 315.1 billion lire, operating income 345.5 billion lire, while its return on equity was 9.5 percent.
The statement said the results were for the first eleven months of 1996 since Crediop SpA started operations on February 1 1996 under San Paolo ownership.
